def: Causing great surprise or wonder; astonishing.
Examine methodically and in detail the constitution or structure of (something, especially information), typically for purposes of explanation and interpretation.
Buy or obtain (an asset or object) for oneself.
A feeling of worry, nervousness, or unease, typically about an imminent event or something with an uncertain outcome.
Anyone.
Successfully bring about or reach (a desired objective, level, or result) by effort, skill, or courage.
Officially agree to or accept as satisfactory.
Move forward in a purposeful way.
Possession of the means or skill to do something.
To any further extent; any longer.
Before or by now or the time in question.
Assign a job or role to (someone)
A person who gives advice in a particular field.
Make an effort to achieve or complete (something, typically a difficult task or action)
Consider or regard in a specified way.
The state of being away from a place or person.
Achieve or amount to as an average rate or amount over a period of time.
The action or process of arriving.
A person who is proficient in sports and other forms of physical exercise.
Used to refer to an additional person or thing of the same type as one already mentioned or known about; one more; a further.
Cease to support or look after (someone); desert.
A complex of runways and buildings for the takeoff, landing, and maintenance of civil aircraft, with facilities for passengers.
An old person.
Bind by the terms of a contract, as one of apprenticeship.
Write the name and address of the intended recipient on (an envelope, letter, or package)
A woman whose profession is acting on the stage, in movies, or on television.
Cause to come to a place or participate in a venture by offering something of interest, favorable conditions, or opportunities.
Put (things) in a neat, attractive, or required order.
In opposition to.
For a short time; fleetingly.
Cover completely with a thick layer of something.
A man or boy in relation to other sons and daughters of his parents.
Take air into the lungs and then expel it, especially as a regular physiological process.
At, into, or across the space separating (two objects or regions)
An advantage or profit gained from something.
Extending or directly underneath, typically with close contact.
Accept (something) as true; feel sure of the truth of.
A room for sleeping in.
A container consisting of one or more cells, in which chemical energy is converted into electricity and used as a source of power.
For the reason that; since.
Keep or put (something) in a steady position so that it does not fall.
In addition to; apart from.
A fence or other obstacle that prevents movement or access.
Make (an atom or compound) form a complex with another.
A legally recognized subject or national of a state or commonwealth, either native or naturalized.
A domestic fowl kept for its eggs or meat, especially a young one.
A commercial business.
Place (a bullet) into the chamber of a gun.
The circumstances that form the setting for an event, statement, or idea, and in terms of which it can be fully understood and assessed.
An organization set up to provide help and raise money for those in need.
A main division of a book, typically with a number or title.
Establish the truth or correctness of (something previously believed, suspected, or feared to be the case)
The practice or skill of preparing food by combining, mixing, and heating ingredients.
Ease the grief or distress of; console.
Give an authoritative order.
Unite; merge.
Express (an opinion or reaction)
Strive to gain or win something by defeating or establishing superiority over others who are trying to do the same.
Write or create (a work of art, especially music or poetry)
Estimate, measure, or note the similarity or dissimilarity between.
An abstract idea; a general notion.
Having the ability, fitness, or quality necessary to do or achieve a specified thing.
In such a way as to allow easy and accurate perception or interpretation.
A nation with its own government, occupying a particular territory.
Making sure of avoiding potential danger, mishap, or harm; cautious.
Cause to change in form, character, or function.
A period of one hundred years.
Organize and carry out.
Direct toward a particular end or object.
Items worn to cover the body.
With little or no space or time in between.
An advisory, deliberative, or legislative body of people formally constituted and meeting regularly.
Bring together or into contact so that a real or notional link is established.
Decisive or critical, especially in the success or failure of something.
Put right (an error or fault)
Relate to; be about.
Communicate with (someone), typically in order to give or receive specific information.
Eat, drink, or ingest (food or drink)
Arrange (something) by mutual agreement or coordination.
Be the captain of (a ship, aircraft, or sports team)
The most important city or town of a country or region, usually its seat of government and administrative center.A place associated more than any other with a specified activity or product.
Take into one's possession or control by force.
A work of art of recognized and established value.
The weather conditions prevailing in an area in general or over a long period.
Bring or gather together (things, typically when scattered or widespread)
The ability to do something that frightens one.
An educational institution or establishment, in particular one providing higher education or specialized professional or vocational training.
The upper interior surface of a room or other similar compartment.
Maintain (tissue cells, bacteria, etc.) in conditions suitable for growth.
A long flat-topped fixture in a store or bank across which business is conducted with customers.
Satisfy (someone)
Eager to know or learn something.
A person or thing that carries, holds, or conveys something.
Determine the behavior or supervise the running of.
A place with a high concentration of a specified type of person or thing.
Engage in competition to attain (a position of power)
Some but not all.
Have or hold (someone or something) within.
Be composed or made up of.
A group of similar things or people positioned or occurring closely together.
A body of water or air moving in a definite direction, especially through a surrounding body of water or air in which there is less movement.
Legally dissolve one's marriage with (someone)
Make a prominent exhibition of (something) in a place where it can be easily seen.
The amount by which something, especially a sum of money, is too small.
Grow or cause to grow and become more mature, advanced, or elaborate.
A picture or diagram made with a pencil, pen, or crayon rather than paint.
Put an end to the existence of (something) by damaging or attacking it.
Showing a great deal of variety; very different.
Do something or have or show qualities worthy of (reward or punishment)
Bring and hand over (a letter, parcel, or ordered goods) to the proper recipient or address.
The action of defending from or resisting attack.
Argue about (something); discuss heatedly.
Order or allow to leave; send away.
Talk about (something) with another person or group of people.
Say something in a solemn and emphatic manner.
Without being affected by; in spite of.
(typically of something regarded as good) become smaller, fewer, or less; decrease.
(of signals or data) expressed as series of the digits 0 and 1, typically represented by values of a physical quantity such as voltage or magnetic polarization.

A disorder of structure or function in a human, animal, or plant, especially one that produces specific signs or symptoms or that affects a specific location and is not simply a direct result of physical injury.
Far away in space or time.
Without discrepancy (used to emphasize the accuracy of a figure or description)
In the same manner or to the same extent.
Publicly display (a work of art or item of interest) in an art gallery or museum or at a trade fair.
Be illustrated or exemplified.
Burst or shatter violently and noisily as a result of rapid combustion, decomposition, excessive internal pressure, or other process, typically scattering fragments widely.
Inspect (someone or something) in detail to determine their nature or condition; investigate thoroughly.
Offset (an item of expenditure) as an expense against taxable income.
Make (an idea, situation, or problem) clear to someone by describing it in more detail or revealing relevant facts or ideas.
Travel in or through (an unfamiliar country or area) in order to learn about or familiarize oneself with it.
Convey (a thought or feeling) in words or by gestures and conduct.
Either of two abstract things that are as different from each other as possible.
The wealth and resources of a country or region, especially in terms of the production and consumption of goods and services.
Hold (someone) closely in one's arms, especially as a sign of affection.
Intensify, increase, or further improve the quality, value, or extent of.
(of a person) old or aging.
In the evening; every evening.
An event or a group of events occurring as part of a larger sequence; an incident or period considered in isolation.
Give intellectual, moral, and social instruction to (someone, especially a child), typically at a school or university.
A natural instinctive state of mind deriving from one's circumstances, mood, or relationships with others.
A part or aspect of something abstract, especially one that is essential or characteristic.
A particular form or version of a published text.
An inherent mental or physical power.
An attacking player in basketball, hockey, or other sports.
The activity of catching fish, either for food or as a sport.
Imagine the occurrence of; fantasize about.
Make into a particular or the required form.
The power or right to act, speak, or think as one wants without hindrance or restraint.
For all future time; for always.
Equivalent to the product of three and five; one more than fourteen, or five more than ten; 15.Fifteen years old.The first point won by a player in a game.
After a long time, typically involving difficulty or delay.
Money provided, especially by an organization or government, for a particular purpose.
A mathematical relationship or rule expressed in symbols.
The action of finding someone or something.
Provide funding for (a person or enterprise)
Literature in the form of prose that describes imaginary events and people.
Of, from, in, or characteristic of a country or language other than one's own.
An emotional state or reaction.
Having or relating to a system of government in which several states form a unity but remain independent in internal affairs.
A person who manufactures articles of cast metal; the owner or operator of a foundry.
Lack of success.
Have as a prominent attribute or aspect.
Chance or luck as an external, arbitrary force affecting human affairs.
The condition of being physically fit and healthy.
The ceremonies honoring a dead person, typically involving burial or cremation.
A grocer's store or business.
(of a living thing) undergoing natural development by increasing in size and changing physically.
A room or building for the display or sale of works of art.
Relating to genes or heredity.
A commander of an army, or an army officer of very high rank.
A movement of part of the body, especially a hand or the head, to express an idea or meaning.
A main road, especially one connecting major towns or cities.
The line at which the earth's surface and the sky appear to meet.
In good health.
Used to introduce a statement that contrasts with or seems to contradict something that has been said previously.
To a great degree; in large amounts.
Used as the object of a verb or preposition to refer to a male person or animal previously mentioned as the subject of the clause.
Giving or ready to give help.
A quantity that fills the hand.
Spend a holiday in a specified place.
The study of past events, particularly in human affairs.
Use (resources) economically; conserve.
Used as the object of a verb or preposition to refer to a female person or animal previously mentioned as the subject of the clause.
A subdivision of a county or shire, having its own court.
The natural home or environment of an animal, plant, or other organism.
The faculty of perceiving sounds.
The activity of hunting wild animals or game, especially for food or sport.
An act of asking for information.
Make or become better.
(of a situation or event) include (something) as a necessary part or result.
Make (someone) feel admiration and respect.
The capacity to gain an accurate and deep intuitive understanding of a person or thing.
Comprise or contain as part of a whole.
Form a mental image or concept of.
Fill (someone) with the urge or ability to do or feel something, especially to do something creative.
As an alternative or substitute.
A person present in a country without official authorization.

A disease or period of sickness affecting the body or mind.

Of extreme force, degree, or strength.
Show or prove to be right or reasonable.
Travel somewhere.

A newspaper or magazine that deals with a particular subject or professional activity.
A room or area where food is prepared and cooked.
A building or room containing collections of books, periodicals, and sometimes films and recorded music for people to read, borrow, or refer to.
To a great extent; on the whole; mostly.
A claim or dispute brought to a court of law for adjudication.

Restricted in size, amount, or extent; few, small, or short.
Guidance or leadership, especially in a spiritual context.

A substance made by mixing other substances together.
Something that is difficult or impossible to understand or explain.
(especially in manufacturing) make or operate on with a machine.
Be wrong about.
Large and heavy or solid.
Relating to the science of medicine, or to the treatment of illness and injuries.
A play or movie in which singing and dancing play an essential part. Musicals developed from light opera in the early 20th century.
A surprising and welcome event that is not explicable by natural or scientific laws and is therefore considered to be the work of a divine agency.
Send a message to (someone), especially by email, text, app, or other electronic means.
(of two people) united in marriage.
What is meant by a word, text, concept, or action.
An assembly of people, especially the members of a society or committee, for discussion or entertainment.
Every morning.
A person responsible for controlling or administering all or part of a company or similar organization.
Observe and check the progress or quality of (something) over a period of time; keep under systematic review.
Ascertain the size, amount, or degree of (something) by using an instrument or device marked in standard units or by comparing it with an object of known size.
An important assignment carried out for political, religious, or commercial purposes, typically involving travel.
The number equivalent to the product of a thousand and a thousand; 1,000,000 or 10⁶
Refer to something briefly and without going into detail.
Connect as or operate with a network.
Not in or to any place; not anywhere.
Not at all.
Used before the first of two (or occasionally more) alternatives that are being specified (the others being introduced by “nor”) to indicate that they are each untrue or each do not happen.
Easily agitated or alarmed; tending to be anxious; highly strung.
Naturally.
Provide with military officers.
A breach of a law or rule; an illegal act.

Easily perceived or understood; clear, self-evident, or apparent.
The way a thing turns out; a consequence.
Relating to or derived from living matter.
In all parts; taken as a whole.
An aperture or gap, especially one allowing access.
A view or judgment formed about something, not necessarily based on fact or knowledge.
Continuing; still in progress.

Situated or moving beyond the boundaries or confines of.

The state or condition of being free from being observed or disturbed by other people.
Put into a box or wrapping, especially for sale.
The state of being extremely poor.
Bring (a vehicle that one is driving) to a halt and leave it temporarily, typically in a car park or by the side of the road.
(in the US) run against (the current holder of a political office) in the preliminary election a party uses to select its candidate for the general election.
Prepare and issue (a book, journal, piece of music, etc.) for public sale, distribution, or readership.
Used to express uncertainty or possibility.
Carry out, accomplish, or fulfill (an action, task, or function)
Make (something) completely free from faults or defects, or as close to such a condition as possible.
The action or process of paying someone or something or of being paid.
Make available for use; supply.
A matter or situation regarded as unwelcome or harmful and needing to be dealt with and overcome.
Say or estimate that (a specified thing) will happen in the future or will be a consequence of something.
A soldier of the lowest rank, in particular an enlisted person in the US Army or Marine Corps ranking below private first class.
Keep (something) from happening or arising.
Provide (a computer or other machine) with coded instructions for the automatic performance of a task.
Describe (a person or organization, especially a public figure) in a short article.
An article or substance that is manufactured or refined for sale.
Make or manufacture from components or raw materials.
Begin or continue a course of action.
Depict (someone or something) in a work of art or literature.
(of a part of the body) affected with pain.
A punishment imposed for breaking a law, rule, or contract.
Have as one's intention or objective.
Assure someone that one will definitely do, give, or arrange something; undertake or declare that something will happen.
Put forward (an idea or plan) for consideration or discussion by others.
Keep safe from harm or injury.
Perform a series of mechanical or chemical operations on (something) in order to change or preserve it.
Further the progress of (something, especially a cause, venture, or aim); support or actively encourage.
Represent (someone or something) in a photograph or picture.
A synthetic material made from a wide range of organic polymers such as polyethylene, PVC, nylon, etc., that can be molded into shape while soft and then set into a rigid or slightly elastic form.
Liked, admired, or enjoyed by many people or by a particular person or group.

Speak and act so as to make it appear that something is the case when in fact it is not.
Subject (a strain of microorganisms or cells) to a passage.
An artist who paints pictures.
Express an objection to what someone has said or done.

Any of a class of nitrogenous organic compounds that consist of large molecules composed of one or more long chains of amino acids and are an essential part of all living organisms, especially as structural components of body tissues such as muscle, hair, collagen, etc., and as enzymes and antibodies.

Strong and barely controllable emotion.
A person receiving or registered to receive medical treatment.
Decorate with a repeated design.
The period of time now occurring.

At a fast speed; rapidly.

In a quiet manner.

Need for a particular purpose.
Politely or formally ask for.
Become fully aware of (something) as a fact; understand clearly.
In a manner lacking gentleness; harshly or violently.

Return to a normal state of health, mind, or strength.

A person who has been forced to leave their country in order to escape war, persecution, or natural disaster.
Admire (someone or something) deeply, as a result of their abilities, qualities, or achievements.

Say something in reply.

Income, especially when of a company or organization and of a substantial nature.

The world or the state of things as they actually exist, as opposed to an idealistic or notional idea of them.

The action or movement of a runner.
Allow or enable to escape from confinement; set free.

Organize according to a routine.

A person or thing that is being discussed, described, or dealt with.
A physical or mental feature which is regarded as indicating a condition of disease, particularly such a feature that is apparent to the patient.
In some way; by some means.
Consume (food or drink) without feeling or being sick.
Continue to live or exist, especially in spite of danger or hardship.
Meet the expectations, needs, or desires of (someone)
A person who speaks.
In a short time; soon.
Rise or come up to the surface of the water or the ground.

The aggregate of people living together in a more or less ordered community.

Achieve the desired aim or result.
Bear all or part of the weight of; hold up.

A rich cream sauce.
A thing, such as an event, product, or broadcast, that is designed or organized for a particular occasion or purpose.
The branch of medical practice that treats injuries, diseases, and deformities by the physical removal, repair, or readjustment of organs and tissues, often involving cutting into the body.
Assume that something is the case on the basis of evidence or probability but without proof or certain knowledge.
The accomplishment of an aim or purpose.

A group of living organisms consisting of similar individuals capable of exchanging genes or interbreeding. The species is the principal natural taxonomic unit, ranking below a genus and denoted by a Latin binomial, e.g. Homo sapiens.A group subordinate to a genus and containing individuals agreeing in some common attributes and called by a common name.
Divide (something) into separate parts or sections.
An action or event regarded as morally or legally wrong and causing general public outrage.

Completely; absolutely.

The quality or state of being different or diverse; the absence of uniformity, sameness, or monotony.

A group of houses and associated buildings, larger than a hamlet and smaller than a town, situated in a rural area.
